Dgame.Graphics.Unit



class Unit: Dgame.Graphics.Spritesheet.Spritesheet;
Unit extends Spritesheet and represent a Game unit, like a gaming piece. It extends SpriteSheet of a speed and a direction value, which can be manipulated. With this additional values the Unit can move with a specific speed in a specific direction with a optional animation (the spritesheet).

Author:
rschuett

final this(Texture tex);
CTor

final this(Texture tex, ref const ShortRect viewport);
CTor

final this(Texture tex, const ShortRect viewport);
CTor

Rvalue version

final const pure nothrow bool isMoving();
Returns if the Unit is moving. This is proven with a check if speed is > 0f.

final void stop();
Stop the Unit. Reset the viewport and the direction

final void setSwap(float swap);
Set a new swap value (starting value is 1f) The swap value affect how fast the Spritesheet pictures are swapped. The Update value is 10f and every frame the current swap/update counter is increased by the swap value. If Update (10f) is reached, the next picture comes.

final const pure nothrow float getSwap();
Returns the current swap value (starting value is 1f)

final void setSpeed(float speed);
Set a new speed

final const pure nothrow float getSpeed();
Returns the current speed (starting value is 1)

final void setDirection(float x, float y);
Set a new direction The direction is the amount of pixels which is added to the current position.

See:
slide

final void setDirection(ref const Vector2f vec);
Set a new direction. The direction is the amount of pixels which is added to the current position.

See:
slide

final void resetDirection();
Set the direction to 0|0

final void reverseDirection();
Reverse the direction

final const pure nothrow ref const(Vector2f) getDirection();
Returns the current directon

final const pure nothrow @property float dirX();
Returns only the x coordinate of the current direction

final const pure nothrow @property float dirY();
Returns only the y coordinate of the current direction

final @property void dirX(float dx);
Set only the x coordinate of the current direction

final @property void dirY(float dy);
Set only the y coordinate of the current direction

final void slide();
Slide/Move the Unit Every time this method is called the current speed is added to an internal update property. If this property reaches 10f or more, the direction is added to the current position and the slideViewport method from Spritesheet ist called. Also the update property is decreased about 10f.
